result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert H. Haskins

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Robert H. Haskins appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an Attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert H. Haskins
Current: 402 Center Street, Boscobel, WI 53805 United States  (Effective: 10-11-2022)
Prior: 44450 Briggs Dr, Soldiers Grove, WI 54655

1:35 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Robert H. Haskin in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:17 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Robert Henry Haskins in court, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Steiner is heard and requests one more week to get the complaint filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Robert Henry Haskins appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.  

State is heard on bond. State requests a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with Miranda Rabe. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 Signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with Miranda Rabe. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with Miranda Rabe.
